comments:
I am getting an exception in the log, although I did not notice anything visible 
at the UI when this was happenning. I was running through update scenarios so 
this may be related to update, but the exception is in UI code around the 
welcome editor, so will have you take the first crack at it.

Steps:
* install clean build (I was running with 0612 08:44 build)
* start up
* Help> Software Updates> New Updates
* should find 1 update for the SDK .... proceed to install it
* restart when prompted
* I opened update manager, in Configuration View expanded the Configuration 
History folder, selected the top configuration (has a little running man 
overlay), and in preview page clicked [Revert]
* restart when prompted
* shut down, restart again

In the last step (not sure if on shut down or restart) I go the following in the 
log:

WelcomeEditor.dispose() does not check for null colorListener, which will not 
have been assigned if createPartControl is not called.

(I thought we established that createPartControl would always be called now?)

Agree that welcome editor should be fixed to check the null case. This is low 
risk.

Workbench.closeAllEditors does not call dispose unless the editor was created. 
So we have a case where the editor was created but createPartControl was never 
called. This will need to be investigated.
Likely due to the fact the the install perspective has its editors hidden.

See Bug 20166 NPE in ClassFileEditorActionContributor while restoring 
workbench

Unlike bug 20166, adding a null check here is not a compromise.
This is a simple fix, and does not depend on bug 20166 being fixed.

Added null check in WelcomeEditor.dispose
Checked with Simon
